entry.title: Re: Is it possible to automate the Excel upload in Manage...
entry.content: @Filip_Polak automating the upload process for Sales Plans in SAP S4/HANA Public Cloud is not directly possible via standard APIs alone. However, it can be achieved through a combination of Business Technology Platform (BTP) integration and custom development. Two-way integration requires event handling or polling mechanisms. Custom CDS views are not suitable for upload but can be used for data extraction when sending changes back to the external system

entry.title: The AI Adoption Journey- Recommendation Station!
entry.content:
Hello All!

This has been the year of AI at SAP Fieldglass, and we‚Äôve been keeping up with the rapid developments! Let‚Äôs chat through some of the latest and greatest in the AI space with SAP Fieldglass.

I know I left you all on a cliffhanger with the ONET codes, so let‚Äôs tackle this one first. This functionality came out a while ago, but its one of the lesser talked about machine learning features!
So, what are the benefits of ‚ÄúRecommend O*NET Code for Job Classification‚Äù feature in Fieldglass? In the last blog, we talked about how the O*NET Resource Center is a database developed by the US Department of Labor.

Fieldglass leverages this database to analyze workforce trends, benchmark salaries and make better informed decisions about talent management. This feature uses AI to recommend job classification codes that align with the database, in both the contingent and SOW modules.
This feature promotes data driven practices by offering companies to tap into a pool of reliable data and potentially unlock advanced analytics. This can highlight any skill gaps, inform them on talent trends, or create an opportunity to develop recruitment strategize by standardizing job data.
Standardizing and streamlining processes allow companies to minimize the administrative burden and human error.

Recommending O*NET Codes isn‚Äôt the only thing Machine Learning can do in Fieldglass now; Qualifications Recommendations has arrived!
In a similar manner, the Qualifications Recommendation will suggest relevant qualifications from the qualification library based on the Job Posting Title and Description. This reduces any manual errors, ensures alignment with role requirements, and shortens the amount of time it takes to create the posting in general.
This can also help with change management- the burden of knowledge or the ‚Äúgo to guy‚Äù isn‚Äôt going to have to be the one to choose which qualifications are best suited for specific requisitions- AI and Machine Learning can recommend them for you!

Something to note here, is that there does have to be an existing qualification library configured.

To learn more about AI, head to the Product Success WorkZone AI Hub and take a look at the interactive learning journeys on O*NET Codes and Qualifications!

entry.title: Business Partner VAT number verification from BADI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_FINAL_CHECK
entry.content:
Hello, how would you go about the following task from an extensibility perspective?

My client, when finishing a delivery, would like to validate a VAT number of the recipient business partner. This means using the BADI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_FINAL_CHECK and calling (in this case) the european VIES registry (public API); and I assume the use of Custom Logic is necessay.

I have set up the Communication System, Arrangement, and Scenario necessary for calling the http request for the registry. A very helpful guide in this was https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EXTENSIBILITY_EXPLORER/580e54f031eb4215b84848ac779e5f17/e8a1ffaad8f7403a95126e1b6f2e8caf.html?locale=en-US 
In Custom Logic I have created a code draft, that creates an http request and sends it to check whether the registry is online. See code below.

Now, the BADI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_FINAL_CHECK  in Custom Logic only allows me to work with DELIVERY_DOCUMENT_IN (delivery document data) and DELIVERY_DOCUMENT_ITEMS_IN (delivery document items data)... How do I access the business partner data such as the VAT number? Is there a select I can do to pull data from released CDS such as I_BUSINESSPARTNER? I have attempted such thing in the code, but the editor throws me a warning/error...
Is this even the right approach?

And a second part to this task - the client requests these calls to be logged somewhere... What would be the best way to log public http API calls such as this? Maybe through a Custom business object? I have never worked with them so far so I don't know how... Is there a better way?

Below is my entire Custom Logic code, most of which is either wrong or can be ignored:

*  Declaration of required parameters
*  DATA LS_BP_ROOT LIKE LINE OF IT_BP_ROOT.
*  DATA LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE LIKE LINE OF MESSAGE.

* For Accessing Customer General Data
*  READ TABLE IT_BP_ROOT INTO LS_BP_ROOT WITH KEY BUSINESSPARTNER = I_CMD_BP_OBJECT_KEY-BUSINESSPARTNER BUSINESSPARTNERUUID = I_CMD_BP_OBJECT_KEY-BUSINESSPARTNERUUID.

* check if the custom fields are filled
  CHECK delivery_document_in-supplier IS NOT INITIAL.
*  CHECK ls_BP_ROOT-include-yy1_vatnumber_bus IS NOT INITIAL.

*check if communication scenario is configured properly
  CHECK cl_ble_http_client=>is_service_available( communication_scenario = 'YY1_DIC_VIES' outbound_service = 'YY1_VALIDATE_VIES_STATUS_REST' ) = abap_true.

  DATA(lo_client) = cl_ble_http_client=>create( communication_scenario = 'YY1_DIC_VIES' outbound_service = 'YY1_VALIDATE_VIES_STATUS_REST' ).


  DATA lv_vatnumber TYPE string.
* convert number field to string
* lv_vatnumber = ls_BP_ROOT-include-yy1_vatnumber_bus.


* CONCATENATE '/' ls_BP_ROOT-include-yy1_vatcountry_bus '/' lv_vatnumber INTO DATA(lv_vat).

  DATA(request) = cl_ble_http_request=>create( ).
  cl_ble_trace_writer=>write_info_message( 'request' ).
  request->set_method( 'GET' ). "->set_resource_extension( ).


  TRY .
      DATA(response) = lo_client->send( request ).
      DATA(lv_body) = response->get_body( ).
      message-messagetype = 'I'.
      message-messagetext = lv_body.
      " Response in fetched in String Format.
      " Do appropriate Split operations to fetch the relevant data
      SPLIT lv_body AT 'valid":' INTO lv_body DATA(lv_body2).
      SPLIT lv_body2 AT ',' INTO DATA(lv_valid) lv_body2.
      IF lv_valid CS 'false'.
        message-messagetype = 'E'.
*      LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE-MSGID = 'CVI_API'.
*      LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE-MSGNO = '010'.
        message-messagetext = 'error message here'.
*      APPEND LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE TO CT_VALIDATIONMESSAGE.
      ELSEIF lv_valid CS 'true'.
        message-messagetype = 'I'.
        message-messagetext = lv_body.
      ENDIF.
    CATCH cx_ble_http_exception INTO DATA(lx).
  ENDTRY.


select * from I_businesspartner 
where businesspartner = @Delivery_document_in-supplier
into @DATA(temp).

message-messagetype = 'S'.
message-messagetext = temp-businesspartner.

entry.title: Re: Migrate partially confirmed production orders
entry.content: As a first step, execute COOIS, filter the status to REL, PCNF and exclude CNF, TECO, DLV & CLSD. With this, you can extract all partially confirmed production orders from Plant A. If your client allows you to reverse or close the orders in source plant, you can do so via CO13 or MIGO, by which, you can close or technically complete the order in Plant A. Recreate all those partially processed orders in Plant B and most importantly, using external number range, for easy traceability. Reapply confirmations or goods issue to match the original order status. Make sure, component availability and BOM consistency in Plant B. From inventory perspective, transfer any WIP or semi-finished goods to Plant B with movement types like 301 or 303 or 309

entry.title: Re: #CoE#MRAS Is there any official Coding Guidelines for...
entry.content:
Hello Yi xie,

Yes, SAP offers a clear, evolving framework for clean core development in S/4HANA.

The guidance centers on maturity levels (A‚ÄìD), explicit extensibility models, governance, and tooling like ATC.  When writing internal coding standards, you can integrate Clean Core guidelines with Clean ABAP style rules for well-structured, future-ready custom development.

A few of the clean core implementation strategies are:-

  1. Lift and Shift
    • Minimal effort, mostly moving existing custom code "as is".
    • Only advisable if code already aligns with Clean Core principles (e.g., modular, uses APIs, no core modifications).
  2. Improve and Move
    • Refactors existing code to introduce clear boundaries and service orientation.
    • Prepares code for compliance with modern ABAP Cloud/side-by-side extensibility.
  3. Rip and Replace Incrementally
    • Targeted modernization: pick a function or feature, redesign it as a clean microservice, and replace it gradually.
    • Ensures minimal disruption while aligning to clean core standards step by step.
  4. Redesign and Replace
    • The most comprehensive transformation.
    • Involves rethinking business processes, collecting requirements, and rebuilding functionality in a clean, extensible way.

 

Why This Matters for New Custom Development

When a new development request comes in, the Clean Core strategy pushes you to:

  • Question whether development is necessary (can the standard process cover it?).
  • If yes, then apply one of the above approaches depending on business needs, risk tolerance, and long-term maintainability.
  • Avoid one-off object-level fixes (as the note mentions) ‚Äî instead think in terms of end-to-end processes and service-based architecture.

I am pasting a couple of SAP learning links which can be helpful for your deep understanding of exploring the clean core approach-

https://learning.sap.com/courses/sap-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-sales/exploring-how-to-make-extensions-clean-core-compliant

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-extensibility-guide-clean-core-for-sap-s-4hana-cloud-august-2025/bc-p/14192298

My Best,

Maciej

entry.title: Re: #CoE#MRAS Is there any official Coding Guidelines for...
entry.content:
Hello @Yi_Xie61 

Yes, use ABAP Cloud and adhere to the Clean Core principles. Your Coe policy should mandate this for any new custom development in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

ABAP Cloud supports only on-stack developer extensibility via RAP; it does not include the traditional approach of mods/enhancements. SAP Help Portal-ABAP Cloud Development Model

Use only publicly available APIs and whitelisted objects, and follow release contracts; do not use unreleased APIS artefacts. SAP Help Portal-Public Released APIs

Enforce quality gates using ATC ABAP Cloud checks, including the Codification Repository rule, and block transports accordingly in violations. SAP Help Portal-Checking Quality of ABAP Code with ATC    GitHub-SAP/

Code style and testability: adhere to Clean ABAP standards, naming, OO design, and unit tests, utilise the official guide and cheat sheet. The GitHub-SAP repository provides SAP style guides for coding and coding-related topics.

Pick the right extensibility model: prefer in-app (key user) for simple changes; on-stack ABAP Cloud (RAP) for tightly coupled apps; BTP side-by-side when you need independent lifecycle, integration services, or multitenancy. SAP Community-SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition - Key User Extensibility (in-app extensibility) Examples 

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to find the APP of the View browser can used in b...
entry.content:
Hello @omega-ou 

Currently, SAP does not provide a single centralized public document that explicitly lists the relationship or mapping between every business catalog and specific data sources like CDS views or analytical cubes in the system. These relationships often depend on delivered content packages curated by SAP based on solution scope and use case.

To find the relationship between Business Catalogs and Data Sources, consider the following:

SAP Business Catalog Documentation or release notes for specific SAP business roles and catalogs describe the key apps and scenarios included. On SAP Help Portal or SAP Learning site, search by the catalog name (e.g., SAP_SD_BC_SO_PROC_MC) for any role or scope information you may require.

SAP Fiori Apps Library provides detailed metadata per app, including data sources used, relevant business catalogs, and business roles. (https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com). It helps you trace the app to its data source or analytical view.

Data sources like generally belong to standard or custom CDS views that analytical queries rely upon. Check the metadata of your CDS view or analytical cube for annotations and published usage details.

To carry out system analysis, use system tools to analyse roles and catalogs or check transport objects to see what transportable content is linked to a catalog. Analyse the authorization objects attached to business catalogs.

Please note that in the SAP Community and Blogs many SAP experts and customers share insights about catalogs and CDS relationships. Therefore, exploring SAP Community Q&A and blogs can provide practical mappings or examples for your consumption.

Here are my recommended steps

  • Use the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library to identify apps in the business catalog and find their data sources.
  • Within SAP, check metadata of your custom CDS views and queries for annotations describing which business catalogs or roles enable access.
  • Contact SAP support for official tailored documentation if needed for complex migration or transport scenarios.

Below are references I recommend you explore

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library

SAP Learning Journeys and Role Documentation pages

This approach will help you identify and confirm the relationship between business catalogs and data sources in a practical and supported way.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: EC Data at Business Goal Level of Variable Pay Worksheet
entry.content:
Hi @amsabi23 

What is the reason for not using Business Goals directly loaded in Variable Pay here ? that's the leading practice.

Back to your question, in order to bring it from EC instead of a lookup table you need to first bring each goal name and goal result into separate columns of the Entry level then bring the right value into your Business Detail ALCF column through an if-then rule pointing to the columnID of the entry level (only possible if you only have one business goal section, ALCF isn't supported for multiple goal sections).

For example the formula in the busdetail ALCF column would look like this:

if(EntryLevel_GoalName="Country Goal 1",EntryLevelGoal1Pct,

if(EntryLevel_GoalName="Country Goal 2",EntryLevelGoal2Pct,

...

))

entry.title: Re: Transfer Dataset
entry.content:
Hi, 
Yes can transfer whole internal table to dataset without loop

first convert your internal as CSV using method (cl_ilm_stor_mon_csv_converter ). It will convert multiple column table into single column (CSV separated) row by row it converts.
Now move csv converted data to internal table (string type). Then concatenate all the lines of CSV to single string and convert as XSTRING with UTF-8. Then Transfer single string to open dataset.

DATA: lt_csv          TYPE ilm_stor_mon_csv_t_csv_data,
      lt_tab       TYPE TABLE OF string,
      lv_bigstring TYPE string,
      lv_xstr      TYPE xstring.

"internal table to CSV table
    lo_csv->if_ilm_stor_mon_csv_converter~set_delimiter(
                  EXPORTING
                    iv_delimiter = ',' ).

      lo_csv->if_ilm_stor_mon_csv_converter~data_to_csv(
                                 EXPORTING
                                   iv_data =  lt_internal_table
                                   iv_header = abap_true
                                 IMPORTING
                                   et_csv = lt_csv ).

"string table
lt_tab = VALUE #( FOR row IN lt_csv ( row-dataline ) ).

      "Concatenate the internal table into one string separated by newline
      CONCATENATE LINES OF lt_tab  INTO lv_bigstring SEPARATED BY cl_abap_char_utilities=>newline.

      "Convert to XSTRING in UTF-8
      lv_xstr = cl_bcs_convert=>string_to_xstring(
                   iv_string   = lv_bigstring
                   iv_codepage = 'UTF-8' ).

      "Write in one shot
      OPEN DATASET lv_txt_file FOR OUTPUT IN BINARY MODE.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        TRANSFER lv_xstr TO lv_txt_file.
        CLOSE DATASET lv_txt_file.
      ENDIF.

This CONCATENATE will handle 35Lakh lines of internal table. 

Regards, 
Kalaislevan S.

entry.title: Re: Business Partner VAT number verification from BADI LE...
entry.content: The challenge in your case is BAdI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_FINAL_CHECK provides only header and item level data from delivery but your requirement is to fetch the VAT number of the recipient Business Partner. Unfortunately, direct SELECT from I_BUSINESSPARTNER is not allowed in Custom Logic due to restricted access to unreleased CDS views. Instead of SELECT, use the READ ENTITIES statement with a released CDS view like I_BusinessPartner.

entry.title: Re: SAP IBP Excel Add-In Save a Free Text field
entry.content:
Hello @raf_lim 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

The standard approach to add textual comments or notes in SAP Integrated Business Planning is through Planning Notes, which are linked to planning objects. However, these are not displayed as separate columns within the planning views or Excel templates. They act more as pop-up or attached metadata.

  1. To enable you access free text columns in IBP Excel, you should note the standard IBP Functionality.
    SAP IBP's predefined planning views do not support free text columns out of the box within Excel add-in templates where data is entered or displayed in grid form. However, you can work around this by
  2. Enhance Planning Views with Custom Key Figures, which allows you to create a custom key figure with string data type to hold short text/comments. This key figure can be included in the planning view for Excel, displaying as a column. The data can be entered and saved via the Excel add-in.
  3. Making use of Custom Excel Templates or BAdI to create user-specific Excel templates or enhance data models to incorporate free text fields. This often requires SAP IBP system custom development or consulting with SAP or implementation partners.
  4. Planning Notes for Detailed Comments can help you manage critical length of comments and it remains the official supported way, though they are outside column data view.

Before implementing, ensure that adding string key figures aligns with your business process and data governance since it changes how comments are managed. Evaluate if business users need search, filter, or reporting based on comments; standard key figures differ in functionality compared to planning notes.

Consult the links below for more details.

SAP Integrated Business Planning

SAP IBP Excel add-in and planning views documentation

To summarise, your business requirement to display a free text column is best met by creating a string key figure included in the Excel planning view, which then allows entry and persistence of comments in dedicated columns.

 

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Do adding the setup formula to processing unit have a...
entry.content:
To answer your specific question "Can These Fields Be Used in Process Industry Scheduling?" Yes, but with conditions:

In process industries, Master Recipe will drive the scheduling, instead of routing and PI Sheets or Process instructions. The setup, processing, and teardown durations are defined at the phase level within the master recipe and calculated using formulas maintained in the work center. If your system is configured for lead-time scheduling, and formulas are maintained correctly, SAP will use setup, processing, and teardown times to calculate operation durations.

entry.title: Re: Best Practice for distributing Key Extensibility Obje...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

 
Organizing transport objects into software collections is crucial for efficient management and deployment in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Here are some best practices for categorizing and assigning key user extensibility objects to different software collections:

Categorizing Software Collections

  1. Business Roles and Authorizations: Create a separate software collection for business roles, spaces, and pages. This helps in managing user access and roles efficiently.

  2. Custom Fields and Logic: Group custom fields and custom logic together. These are often related and can be transported together to ensure consistency.

  3. UI Adaptations: Use a dedicated collection for UI adaptations, such as changes made using the Adapt UI feature. This ensures that all user interface changes are managed together.

  4. Custom Business Objects: Create collections specifically for custom business objects and their related elements. This helps in managing custom data structures separately.

  5. Analytics and KPIs: Group custom analytical queries, KPIs, and reports in a single collection. This allows for streamlined management of analytics-related changes.

Best Practices for Assigning Key User Extensibilities

  • Dependency Management: Ensure that items with dependencies are included in the same software collection. Use the ‚ÄòAdd Missing Items‚Äô feature to automatically include dependent items.

  • Consistency and Testing: Before exporting, use the ‚ÄòCheck‚Äô feature to verify items for inconsistencies and dependencies. This helps prevent errors during import.

  • Version Control: Regularly update and manage software collections to reflect changes Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Export Software Collection in your development environment. Avoid using outdated collections.

  • Transport Automation: Consider using transport automation settings to schedule regular imports and forwards, ensuring timely updates across systems.

By following these practices, you can effectively manage and deploy key user extensibility objects, ensuring smooth transitions and minimizing errors during transport.

For more detailed guidance, refer to the SAP documentation Export and Import Software collections in S4 Hana ‚Ä¶ - SAP Community Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Importing a Software Collection and community resources.

[1] Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Export Software Collection
[2] Export and Import Software collections in S4 Hana ... - SAP Community
[3] Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Importing a Software Collection

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: NEW! Business Process Management with SAP Signavio
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION:

The ability to read and design business process diagrams (and other diagrams) and then utilize them to analyze and improve processes is integral to many professions. SAP Signavio is an easy-to-use tool that assists the users in doing just that. Furthermore, SAP Signavio encourages and even enforces notational standards such as BPMN, DMN, UML and others to make the diagrams more easily consumed.

This Academic Lesson consists of two Activities ‚Äì the first introduces the students to the benefits of process documentation and provides opportunities for the students to create their own business process diagrams using BPMN. The skills they learn may be transferred to other diagramming types and frameworks. The second Activity is theoretical only and provides a deep dive into additional features of SAP Signavio. If the students complete both the first and second Activity, they will have the basic knowledge to take the exam that earns the SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì Process Management Consultant ‚Äì SAP Signavio certification.

SUGGESTED AREAS OF STUDY:

Business: project management, operations management, audit, information systems, risk management, accounting information systems, and most other business majors, engineering, public administration, health/medical management and administration, and any other area of study requiring process management or analysis.

Appropriate for students at undergraduate and graduate level university, community college, and trade school.

Microsoft Word (editable) format: https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/EzLtiKm?rc=10&doi=SAP1235681&includeRelatedAssets=true 

PDF (non-edible) format: https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/5VbdD56?rc=10&doi=SAP1235682

entry.title: Re: PGI failing against an Outbound Delivery using APIs w...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

When you encounter a 412 error while posting a PGI (Post Goods Issue) against an Outbound Delivery using SAP APIs, it typically indicates that the ETag you are using is outdated. Here are steps to resolve this issue:

  1. Ensure Correct ETag Handling: APIs for Delivery and Transportation - PostGoodsIssue

    • Before making a POST request for PGI, perform a GET request to retrieve the current ETag of the outbound delivery. This ensures you are working with the latest version of the document.
    • Use the retrieved ETag in the ‚ÄòIf-Match‚Äô header of your POST request.

  2. Check for Concurrent Updates:

    • Ensure that no other operations are being performed on the same delivery document that might change its state between your GET and POST requests.

  3. Integration Suite Adjustments:

    • If using Integration Suite, ensure that your iFlow correctly fetches the ETag before attempting the PGI operation. You might need to add a step to retrieve the ETag and APIs for Delivery and Transportation - ETag Handling store it for use in the subsequent POST request.

  4. Verify API Endpoint and Parameters:

    • Double-check the API endpoint and parameters used in your POST request. Ensure they match the required format and include all necessary headers.

  5. Consult Documentation and Community:

    • Refer to SAP documentation and community forums for additional guidance and troubleshooting tips.

By following these steps, you should be able to resolve the 412 error and successfully post a PGI using SAP APIs.

 

 
[1] APIs for Delivery and Transportation - PostGoodsIssue

 

[2] APIs for Delivery and Transportation - ETag Handling

Kind regards,

Henrike

How to Copy Billing Plan from KMAT Material to Finished Goods in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

To achieve the copying of the billing plan from a KMAT material to a Finished Goods material within the same sales order, you need to ensure that the copying control settings are correctly configured. Here are the steps you can follow:

  1. Check Copying Control Settings: Sales - Copying Control Ensure that the copying control settings for sales documents to billing documents are configured to allow the transfer of billing plan data. This involves setting up the correct data flow and ensuring that the billing plan is included in the items being copied.

  2. Custom Logic Implementation: Sales - Data Flow You may need to implement custom logic using Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) to ensure that the billing plan data is transferred correctly. The BAdI SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER can be used to customize the data transfer routines and copying requirements.

  3. Configuration of Billing Plan Types: How to create the sales Bill of Material (BOM) or ‚Ä¶ - SAP Community Verify that the billing plan types are correctly defined and associated with the item categories involved. This ensures that the billing plan data is recognized and copied during the sales order creation process.

  4. Review Item Category Settings: Ensure that the item categories for both KMAT and Finished Goods materials are set up to allow billing plan copying. This might involve checking the billing relevance and other related settings.

  5. Testing and Validation: After making the necessary configurations, test the process to ensure that the billing plan is copied as expected. Validate the results to confirm that the billing plan section is not greyed out and that the checkbox issue is resolved.

For more detailed guidance, you may need to consult SAP documentation or seek assistance from SAP support to address specific configuration issues related to your scenario.

entry.title: Re: Business Partner VAT number verification from BADI LE...
entry.content:
Hello @Filip_Polak 

Here‚Äôs the secure, cloud-compatible method to accomplish this in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

 Hook is correct
Use BAdI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_FINAL_CHECK to run your validation before saving the delivery.

SAP Help Portal 

SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Get the VAT number (don‚Äôt SELECT unreleased tables)
Inside the BAdI, read the partner ID from the import structure such as ship-to for outbound, supplier for inbound then fetch the VAT using one of these approved options:

Released CDS: Read from I_BusinessPartnerTaxNumber (if released in your tenant). This view is the Cloud-approved way to access BP tax numbers. Check release in View Browser; if released, SELECT ‚Ä¶ FROM I_BusinessPartnerTaxNumber WHERE BusinessPartner = @lv_bp AND TaxNumberCategory = <country VAT cat> is allowed.

SAP Support Portal-2797772 - S/4HC: How to access Business Partner Tax Number via CDS views

SAP Fiori Apps Library

OData API (always released): Consume Business Partner (A2X), entity A_BusinessPartnerTaxNumber, via a Service Consumption Model + Communication Arrangement (same pattern you used for VIES). Filter by BusinessPartner plus TaxNumberCategory country-specific VAT categories, example DE0/FR0/NL0

 SAP Help Portal-Business Partner (A2X) ‚Äì OData API

GitHub

Notes:
‚Ä¢ VAT is maintained under Identification - Tax Numbers in the BP UI; SAP documents the country VAT categories and formats. SAP Help Portal-Tax Number Categories
‚Ä¢ If I_BusinessPartnerTaxNumber isn‚Äôt released in your system version, use the API route above.

Call VIES from ABAP Cloud your approach is fine
Use CL_BLE_HTTP_CLIENT with your outbound service Destination/Comm. Arrangement. Handle timeouts and parse the JSON response; SAP‚Äôs tutorial shows the exact pattern from Custom Logic/CBO logic. SAP-Execute an Outbound Service from Custom Business Object Logic

Decide what happens on failure
Operationally, consider VIES being down as not equivalent to VAT being invalid. The typical pattern is:

  • Error only if VIES returns explicitly invalid - block save raise message in the BAdI.
  • Warning if VIES not reachable - allow save plus log for follow-up.

Log every call and result (auditable)
Use Application Log (BALI) from ABAP Cloud to persist entries time, BP, VAT, request/response, outcome. View via the Application Logs, app. If you need custom KPIs/UI, persist to a Custom Business Object. SAP Help Portal-Writing Application Logs to the Database    SAP-Create Custom Business Objects in S/4HANA Cloud

Delivery BAdIs (Final Check): Purpose and Usage. SAP Help Portal-Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Delivery Management

Let me now if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: CDS Views: The Key to a "Clean Core" and a More Agile SAP
entry.content:
What is a CDS View?

In SAP S/4HANA, a CDS View (Core Data Services) is the modern way to create an intelligent, semantic data layer directly on the SAP HANA database. Think of it as a "super-advanced filter" or a virtual report that organizes and makes information from various tables available in a consistent, standardized, and reusable way.

  • It's a method to centralize and standardize data access, eliminating the need for repetitive and complex code for queries.

  • It serves as a single source of truth, allowing Fiori apps, analytical reports, APIs, and even external integrations to consume the same data consistently.

An Analogy:

Imagine you have a stack of information in different spreadsheets. Instead of manually joining, copying, and pasting data to create a report, you build a CDS View.

This CDS View is a "virtual report" you create just once. In it, you define exactly what data you need from which spreadsheets (tables), how they connect, and how they should be presented (for example, "this column represents a monetary value").

Why are CDS Views Essential in S/4HANA?

  • Unmatched Performance: A CDS View processes data where it lives‚Äîon the database, the "filing room." Instead of moving large volumes of data to the "office" (application server), all the logic is executed locally, which is incredibly faster, especially with the power of SAP HANA.

  • Versatility and Reusability: Once you create a CDS View, you can use it for various purposes without replicating your work. The same data view can be used to:

    • Create an analytical chart on a dashboard.

    • Build a mobile app (Fiori).

    • Generate a detailed report for management.

  • Built-in Intelligence: A CDS View goes far beyond just displaying data. It is "intelligent" by nature. Within it, you can embed business rules, such as "show only sales from the last quarter" or "restrict salary viewing to managers only."

The Context: SAP's Evolution to S/4HANA

The creation of CDS Views is directly tied to the evolution of SAP's technology. Before the arrival of SAP HANA, the architecture was traditional: ABAP programs ran on an application server, and data resided on a separate database server.

For any analysis or report, large volumes of data had to be transferred from the database to the application server. This back-and-forth was slow and inefficient, creating a performance bottleneck.

With HANA, everything changed. As an in-memory database, it processes data at extremely high speeds. SAP then adopted the "Code-to-Data" (or "Code Pushdown") philosophy‚Äîthat is, "pushing" the processing logic to where the data already is: on the database itself.

This is where the CDS View finds its purpose:

  • Overcoming the Past: Old database views were simple and static. CDS Views were created to be an intelligent new data modeling layer that leverages all the capabilities of HANA, such as parallel processing and real-time analytics.

  • Centralizing Logic: They allow developers to define business logic (calculations, filters, aggregations) and access rules directly in the view, centralizing technical knowledge in a single location.

  • Preparing for the Future: CDS Views were SAP's solution to support the new SAP Fiori interface and embedded analytics tools. With semantic annotations, they make it easy to create modern, intuitive applications that understand the meaning of the data.

The Connection to the "Clean Core" Strategy

The CDS View is the central tool that SAP provides to put the Clean Core strategy into practice. The goal of the Clean Core is to keep the S/4HANA system as close as possible to its standard version, avoiding direct modifications to its "core."

Traditionally, companies altered standard code and tables, making future upgrades and innovations very expensive and complex.

CDS Views changed the game. Instead of modifying what already exists, developers create CDS Views to meet specific needs.

  • Extensions Without Complications: Instead of modifying a standard SAP table, you create an extension CDS View, adding fields or logic without touching the original object.

  • Abstraction and Protection: CDS Views act as an abstraction layer. Your application only communicates with the view, not with the standard table. This means that if the underlying table structure changes in a future upgrade, your application won't be affected because the CDS View can be adjusted to absorb the change.

  • Smoother Upgrades: Because customizations are in separate objects (the CDS Views), the process of upgrading to a new S/4HANA version becomes much safer and faster, without the risk of code conflicts.

  • Centralized Consistency: By centralizing business logic in CDS Views, you prevent code duplication and ensure that rules are applied consistently throughout the system.

The Clean Core is a strategy that aims to keep the SAP S/4HANA system as close as possible to its original standard. Historically, companies customized SAP by altering core tables and programs, which made upgrades complex, slow, and expensive.

CDS Views emerged as the ideal tool to solve this problem. They allow you to add your business logic and customizations without modifying SAP's standard code.

Usefull Links:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/5418de55938d1d22e10000000a44147b.html

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/code-to-data-paradigm-in-abap-with-sap-hana/ba-p/13428352

entry.title: Stay up-to-date on your SAP Cloud services and system status with timely notifications
entry.content:
Are you interested in receiving timely communication about your SAP Cloud Services and system availability? This blog post will guide you through the process of getting notified about system status updates, planned and unplanned maintenance, service disruptions, and more. 

 
These notifications come from the SAP Cloud Availability application maintained within SAP for Me.‚ÄØTo better understand this feature and explore its functionalities, I encourage you to check these meaningful contents:  
 
All you need to know about SAP Cloud Availability
2548400 - Getting started with the SAP‚ÄØ Cloud‚ÄØ Availability‚ÄØ- SAP for Me 
 
 
Now, let‚Äôs get you set up to receive the alerts.   
 
SAP Cloud Notification subscriptions ‚Äì Get Notified 

First, you should consider there are two available options to subscribe for SAP Cloud Notifications. They can be added and managed either by yourself or by your company‚Äôs Super or Cloud Administrators.  
 
Please Note:  
Previously, some cloud subscription options did not require an S-user ID. When these subscriptions were migrated to the cloud notification application, non-users were also migrated.  Individuals that have subscribed for cloud notifications without having an S-user ID must contact their Super or Cloud Administrators to manage the subscriptions on their behalf.  

Administrators can manage the subscriptions for non S-user contacts from the same application as for S-user IDs. The ‚ÄòUser Type‚Äô filter can be a helpful tool to quickly distinguish between both scenarios. Below you'll find the steps and documentation reference for this. 
 
 
Subscribing your own S-user ID for Cloud Notifications 

Ensure your S-User ID is assigned with one of the authorizations below:   

  • Display System Data.   
  • Edit System Data.   

 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab. 
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. 
  3. Select ‚ÄòAdd New Subscription‚Äô. 

  4. A pop-up window will enable you to select your subscription preferences.  
  5. Click ‚ÄòSave‚Äô to reflect your elections.  

Your subscription will now be added and can be managed directly from the Get Notified tab.  
 

To adjust your notification preferences or unsubscribe from an existing one, simply locate the subscription through ‚ÄòMy Subscriptions‚Äô and click on the corresponding icon based on the desired action (Pencil icon = edit / Trash can icon = delete).

Check the following SAP Knowledge Base Article for additional reference on this process: 2900069 - How S-users manage their own‚ÄØCloud‚ÄØNotification‚ÄØsubscriptions - SAP for Me.  

 

Adding Cloud Notifications for other S-user IDs as a Super or Cloud Administrator 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab.  
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. Switch to ‚ÄòManage Subscriptions‚Äô.  
  3. Select ‚ÄòAdd New Subscription‚Äô.    
  4. In the pop-up window, enter the subscription options and the S-user(s) to get notified via the ‚ÄòContacts‚Äô field.
     
  5. Save the subscription selection.  

Once completed, Administrators can manage the subscriptions from the same application by locating it and selecting the relevant action. Options include adding subscriber, editing or deleting the subscription.   

Further guidance is available in the article 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users - SAP for Me.  
 

Support Resources 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, you can always refer to the following support options: 

  • Create a Support Case: For any technical issues related to the Get Notified application, create a case selecting ‚ÄòSAP for ME‚Äô and ‚ÄòSystems & Provisioning > Get Notified‚Äô under product related fields. Follow the steps from SAP Knowledge Base Article ‚ÄØ1296527 for further guidance.  
     
  • SAP Customer Interaction Center: For navigation or initial troubleshooting assistance, feel free to reach out to the Customer Interaction Center team: Contact Customer Interaction Center. 
     

Thank you for reading! We hope you found this helpful and would love to hear your thoughts about this blog post. Let us know what you think!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
‚ÄØ 
Stay tuned for our upcoming Support Webinars and recorded sessions to continuously learn and get the best from SAP Support: ‚ÄØRegister Now‚ÄØ 
 

Read more #CustomerInteractionCenter‚ÄØblog posts‚ÄØhere!

entry.title: SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary - bigger and better than ever
entry.content:
Come see SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) at this year‚Äôs SAP Connect / Success Connect event in Las Vegas! Due to the ever-increasing interest in SAP BTP topics and our sessions in prior years having standing-room only attendance, SAP BTP has more sessions than ever before! We even have for the first time ever, not one, but two hands-on-labs!

SAP BTP topics for 2025

This year‚Äôs SAP BTP for HR experience at SAP Connect is all about more. More business scenarios, more technology, more platform - more BTP! This year‚Äôs topics include customer favorites such as integration, extensibility and automation as well as numerous SAP SuccessFactors product-led sessions about how SAP BTP helps them deliver better solutions making it easier for customers to streamline HCM processes. Additionally, as we see an increase in technical audience members, we‚Äôll be featuring slightly more
technical product deep dives by the product teams (also a first for us!).

Demos and hands-on labs

Demo-station demo: Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding, featuring Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh

We‚Äôre showcasing two demos at the ‚ÄúIntegration and Extension with SAP BTP‚Äù demo station. The first is our popular Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding demo which shows SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs Advanced Event Mesh event-driven integration capabilities to provide automated equipment ordering. This dramatically reduces the amount of time a people manager spends ordering equipment as well as requesting access to systems and data. If you missed this demo in Lisbon last year, then this is your chance!  Included are:

  • See how we used SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to analyze onboarding processes to identify key areas to address inefficiencies: hiring manager ordering of equipment, waiting for responses from people via email
  • SAP Integration Suite and advanced event mesh which offers real-time triggering of data synchronization based on SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central event triggers
  • An example app an IT department can create to offer pre-bundled packages of equipment to make it easier for managers to pick equipment, and to standardize offerings
  • One-click approvals by the hiring manager, powered by SAP Build 
  • Automatically submitting equipment selection to SAP Ariba guided buying via SAP Integration Suite
  • Notifications pushed to the task center for the hiring manager via SAP Build
  • Automatic submission of support tickets to SAP Service Cloud for manual tasks like requesting access to systems and data


Demo-station demo: Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo and hands-on lab

Additionally, we‚Äôre showing our brand new Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo which is specifically designed for more technical HRIS audiences in collaboration with the SAP SuccessFactors team. 

This demo is also the basis of two, 75-minute hands-on labs we‚Äôre offering this year which are sure to sell out! The lab will walk non-technical novices and intermediate technical knowledge people (non-developers, IT and HRIS are our target audience) on how to use SAP Build to quickly and easily create a mobile app with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central people data to offer location-specific benefits for a field office ‚Äì all with no coding, using SAP Build‚Äôs powerful drag-and-drop development interface. We‚Äôll have product experts from the SAP Build team presenting and explaining to the audience the different capabilities of SAP Build in a follow-the-presenter format from their own workstations in live SAP Build environments so everyone will be able to walk away with direct product knowledge of what‚Äôs possible.
Included in the session:

  • Overview of the low-code SAP Build environment
  • Overview of various content types, controls, functions available
  • Adding content and configuring to the controls
  • Using an integration to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central for people data
  • Accessing benefits information in the employee profile via API
  • Customizing the look and feel of the app
  • Testing the app and deployment

entry.title: 2H 2025 Onboarding (Preview): Employee‚ÄëInitiated Corrections to Form I‚Äë9 Section 1
entry.content:
With an upcoming release, we‚Äôre introducing a new, employee‚Äëinitiated Section 1 Correction flow in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding (Form I‚Äë9). This capability lets a new hire securely correct mistakes in Section 1‚Äîand re‚Äëattest‚Äîwithout restarting onboarding or relying on ad‚Äëhoc admin work.

Disclaimer: Forward‚Äëlooking statements. Scope and timing may change before General Availability (GA). This post is for informational purposes only and is not legal advice.

What‚Äôs changing

  • New self‚Äëservice flow for new hires to request and complete a correction to Section 1.

  • Re‚Äëattestation and e‚Äësignature are captured as part of the correction.

  • Version history & audit preserve a full trail.

  • As a separate but related change, we are also removing the "Validate & Save" button from Form I-9.
    • Why is this being removed? This button doesn't actually "Save" a draft version of the Form I-9 at any point, as we do not want to inadvertently expose sensitive, personally identifiable information. "Validation" is also provided built-in to the page as well, as Onboarding does not permit an employee or HR Users to advance to eSignature without providing a valid set of documents and related information.

Why it matters

  • Keeps accountability for Section 1 with the employee, per program guidance.

  • Reduces manual reopening and support tickets for HR teams.

  • Ensures downstream systems (including E‚ÄëVerify, if used) receive corrected data.

  • Improves auditability and compliance posture during internal/external reviews.

How it works (high‚Äëlevel)

The new "Correct Personal Data" button on Form I-9 Section 1 in the lower right-hand corner

  1. The new hire (employee) now may start a correction from the Form I-9 Section 1. They provide a Reason for why this is being initiated.

  2. Once started, they are redirected back to the Personal Data Collection step to modify or correct any data as desired.

  3. Submit the changes. Onboarding now advances them back to the New Hire Checklist, and from here to the corrected/modified Form I-9 Section 1.

  4. Reviewing and attesting to the corrected information is completed by the employee, who then provides their eSignature.

Note: HR cannot change Section 1 on behalf of the employee in this flow. Corrections remain employee‚Äëinitiated.

Note: New Hires can re-initiate the Correction process again here; the Notification itself will only send when the Form I-9 Section 1 is completed, so as to avoid allowing the New Hire to send dozens of Correction Notifications to HR User.

Configuration & controls

  • This is a universal feature that will be enabled for all customers.

    • Why is this set up as universal? We expect this will drive efficiencies for our HR Users and Hiring Managers are New Hires/employees now have the opportunity to self-correct their own data, rather than being reliant on HR Users and Hiring Managers to initiate a correction or restart Onboarding entirely.

  • Eligibility window (for example, until Section 2 is complete, or until an E‚ÄëVerify case is created).

  • Notifications & templates for HR Users and Hiring Managers that such a change has been made.

  • Reporting/Audit: version history with old/new values, attestation, signature, timestamp, and reason code.

What this feature doesn‚Äôt change

  • Does not reopen Section 2 automatically, nor alter reverification schedules.

  • Does not allow HR to directly edit an employee‚Äôs Section 1 within this flow.

Availability

This is presently targeted for availability with the 1H 2026 Release first in our Preview,  and then Production tenants . Please check our updated What's New Viewer, as well as our updated Implementation Guide for further details.

Please note, this feature is not available for Onboarding 1.0.

We would strongly encourage you to test this feature functionality in October 2026 with the upcoming Preview Release! Please ensure you mark any bugs, defects, or actionable feedback you want to provide the Cloud Product Support team with a Subject of: "1H 2026 Form I-9 New Hire Restart Issue:" to ensure this is received and reviewed appropriately. Thank you

This blog reflects product direction at the time of writing and may change without notice. Always consult your legal counsel for compliance matters.

entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Default values in SAP SAC Excel Add-IN while publishi...
entry.content:
It actually is context based. Data source was not part of the excel sheet. Before the changes were moved to production tenant, whenever manual posting were done, they were posted to Unassigned data source. After the changes were moved to production tenant, entries were posted in the model with data source as COPY_FROM_LABOR. Hence, when there is a manual adjustment, data is automatically posted to the respective data sources. Hence closing the case.

Thanks,

PS

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
I have to add my frustration to this change as well.  In fact I was just on with SAP CIC regarding this issue and I was directed to this blog to share my dissatisfaction.

As a partner whose gone through some M&A activity we have a dozen active S-ID's (one for each corporate entity) that we must routinely log in to all of them to pull a consolidated view across our entire company.  It's taken SAP over 4 years now and they still don't have all accounts merged into a single account so multiple log in's everytime I do something is the norm.  This doesn't include the hundreds of client systems we need access to as well.

While the Universal ID wasn't perfect, it worked reasonably well.   The "NEW" Solution promises to be better (log in once and move from S-ID to S-ID without logging out.....Excellent!) but SAP disabling the old when the new isn't ready is a real head scratcher.

If we as a partner deployed our customer this way SAP would be all over us for poorly managing the deployment and negatively impacting our clients.  Why isn't the same expectation made by SAP to their own projects?

Can someone from SAP please explain why the old system can't be left in place until the new one is production ready?

entry.title: Re: Cycle counter using AUoM has +/-'ve negated adjustmen...
entry.content:
Hello,

If the booked qty is in BUoM and Counted qty is AUoM( SUom or PUoM), system will always create +/- entries and SAP always records this as difference in system. User should always Book inventory counting in AUoM( PAC in your case) or BUoM. To always have booking and counting in AUoM( PAC), use BAdI /SCWM/EX_CORE_RMS_OPUNIT or use Preferred UOM( with some exception) to influence Operative UOM during PI process.

Reference- 3273494 - FAQ: Physical inventory in EWM

Br

Shailesh

entry.title: Re: Real Estate Contract management: How to maintain Notes
entry.content:
Hello @munipkumar 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition Contract and Lease Management / RE-FX, contract notes or memos can only be updated through released APIs. Classic long-text function modules like READ_TEXT/SAVE_TEXT are not allowed in ABAP Cloud. Consequently, your available options are:e.

Use the Real Estate Contracts OData V4 API
Check the service API_REAL_ESTATE_CONTRACT. If your tenant‚Äôs version includes a text/memo sub-node in the service metadata, you can POST or PATCH that entity from your ABAP Cloud logic using a Service Consumption Model, or from an external client. This is the standard method for programmatically writing notes contracts. SAP Help Portal

If the note or memo entity isn't exposed in your release, you won‚Äôt be able to write long text from on-stack ABAP because there's no released API. Instead, use one of these supported patterns:

Attachments API (A2X API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV) allows uploading text, HTML, or PDF notes and associating them with the contract. This feature is fully supported in Public Cloud. SAP Help Portal

Create a long-text custom field for a Custom Business Object (CBO), if the Real Estate Fiori app allows extensibility, or store notes in a CBO identified by the Contract UUID. Then, display this information through your own RAP UI. This approach is advised as a fallback if the standard API does not provide access to notes. SAP Extensibility Explorer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Place the logic where necessary. If validation or auto-creation of a note is needed during contract processing, use Custom Logic (BAdIs for CLM) and invoke the API within ABAP Cloud using an HTTP destination and service proxy. SAP Support Portal-3579041 - Contract and Lease Management: BAdIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

Practical steps

Open the Help Portal, navigate to Real Estate Contracts (API_REAL_ESTATE_CONTRACT), and review $metadata for a text/memo entity or navigation. If identified, proceed with writing through the service proxy. SAP Help Portal

If it's not available, switch to using the Attachments API by creating a Notes attachment type, or add a CBO plus an extension field on the contract UI if possible.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Custom field in EPPM WBS structure
entry.content:
Hello @FranciscoCosta.

Thank you for your feedback and follow up,

Understood, that UI behaviour is logical.You only see Properties because the field is a standard element. The Expression tab is available only for a Calculated element. In Custom CDS Views, use Add and then select Calculation.

Aggregation appears in Element Properties only for numeric measure fields in analytical views. Mark the field as a measure and choose a Default Aggregation. The effect is visible when using the view, such as in Custom Analytical Queries, not in the preview.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales orders
entry.content:
Hi,

The company is in japan , the tax rate for domestic sales orders in Japan is 10% .

Meanwhile, the Japanese yen currency does not have a decimal point.

For example, when we create a sales order with a net value of 115 and the system calculates a sales tax of 12, but the actual tax amount is 11, how can we adjust the tax amount?
